body_html:
What do you mean?

The plugin architecture defines how the dynamic libraries are loaded.

http://openeffects.org/documentation/guide/

Currently I have made it work by putting each of the plugins into one binary so they share the same instance. But if i want to ship two products seperately or if another vendor want to make use of tensorflow under the OpenFX framework we will end up that the first plugin to load will work, but after that it will result in a segfault.
body_text:
What do you mean?
The plugin architecture defines how the dynamic libraries are loaded.
http://openeffects.org/documentation/guide/
Currently I have made it work by putting each of the plugins into one binary so they share the same instance. But if i want to ship two products seperately or if another vendor want to make use of tensorflow under the OpenFX framework we will end up that the first plugin to load will work, but after that it will result in a segfault.
body:
What do you mean?

The plugin architecture defines how the dynamic libraries are loaded.

http://openeffects.org/documentation/guide/


Currently I have made it work by putting each of the plugins into one binary so they share the same instance. But if i want to ship two products seperately or if another vendor want to make use of tensorflow under the OpenFX framework we will end up that the first plugin to load will work, but after that it will result in a segfault.
